Interface ObjectiveFunction

All Superinterfaces:
LossFunction
All Known Implementing Classes:
ObjectiveFunctionImpl
@DomainObject @Strategy(INTERFACE) public interface ObjectiveFunction extends LossFunction
Represents an objective function that extends the concept of a LossFunction to provide both loss aggregation and gradient computation.

An ObjectiveFunction defines how the overall loss is calculated across a batch of samples, as well as how the gradients are determined for optimization algorithms (e.g., stochastic gradient descent).

Unlike DimensionLossFunction, SampleLossFunction, or BatchLossFunction, which focus on specific granularities, an objective function typically provides the entry point for a training process, combining loss evaluation and gradient calculation in one place.

  • Method Details

    • calculateLoss

      float calculateLoss(List<Pair<float[],float[]>> batch)
      Calculates the loss for a batch of samples.

      Each sample in the batch is represented as a Pair of float[] arrays, where the left element is the estimated (predicted) values and the right element is the target (expected) values. Implementations should define how individual sample losses are aggregated into a single scalar loss for the batch.

      Parameters:
      batch - a list of samples, where each sample is a pair of float[] arrays (estimated vs target)
      Returns:
      the aggregated loss value for the batch

    • calculateGradient_dJ_da

      float[] calculateGradient_dJ_da(int samples, float[] estimated, float[] target)
      Determines the gradients of the objective function with respect to the estimated values, for a single sample.

      Implementations should return a gradient array that corresponds in length and order to the estimated array, such that each entry can be used to update model parameters during optimization.

      Parameters:
      samples - the total number of samples in the batch
      estimated - the predicted values for a sample
      target - the expected target values for the sample
      Returns:
      an array of gradients, one per dimension of the input

    • minimize

      static ObjectiveFunction minimize(BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction, SampleLossFunction sampleLossFunction, DimensionLossFunction... dimensionLossFunctions)
      Creates an ObjectiveFunction that minimizes the loss according to the given loss function components.

      This factory method composes together a BatchLossFunction, a SampleLossFunction, and one or more DimensionLossFunctions into a concrete ObjectiveFunction implementation. The resulting objective function calculates dimension-level errors, aggregates them into sample losses, and then aggregates those sample losses into a batch-level loss suitable for optimization.

      The intent of this method is to provide a convenient entry point for constructing custom objective functions when the optimization goal is loss minimization (as is typical in regression and classification problems).

      Parameters:
      batchLossFunction - the function used to aggregate losses across the entire batch
      sampleLossFunction - the function used to aggregate losses within a single sample
      dimensionLossFunctions - one or more functions used to compute loss at the individual dimension level
      Returns:
      a composed ObjectiveFunction that minimizes loss
